# Assessment Templates

> Reusable templates for course assessments

## Available Templates

| Template | Purpose | Course Type |
|----------|---------|-------------|
| [CAPSTONE-BRIEF.md](CAPSTONE-BRIEF.md) | Final project requirements | All |
| [CAPSTONE-RUBRIC.md](CAPSTONE-RUBRIC.md) | Capstone grading criteria | All |
| [MILESTONE-PROJECT.md](MILESTONE-PROJECT.md) | Mid-course checkpoint | Self-paced |

---

## Assessment Strategy Overview

### Self-Paced Courses (12 modules)

| Component | Weight | Description |
|-----------|--------|-------------|
| Module Exercises | 30% | 2.5% per module |
| Module Quizzes | 20% | 1.67% per module |
| Milestone Projects | 20% | 2 projects, 10% each |
| Final Capstone | 30% | Comprehensive project |

### Instructor-Led Courses (8 modules)

| Component | Weight | Description |
|-----------|--------|-------------|
| Module Quizzes | 15% | 2.5% per quiz |
| Labs & Exercises | 25% | 3.125% per lab |
| Participation | 10% | Engagement |
| Final Capstone | 40% | Comprehensive project |
| Presentation | 10% | Capstone demo |

---

## Grading Standards

### Passing Threshold
- **Quizzes:** 70% minimum
- **Labs/Exercises:** 70% minimum
- **Capstone:** 70% minimum
- **Overall Course:** 70% minimum

### Grade Scale

| Grade | Score | Description |
|-------|-------|-------------|
| A | 90-100% | Excellent |
| B | 80-89% | Good |
| C | 70-79% | Satisfactory |
| F | <70% | Needs improvement |

---

## Using These Templates

### For Quizzes
Use module templates: [Quiz Template](../modules/self-paced/QUIZ.md)

### For Exercises
Use module templates: [Exercise Template](../modules/self-paced/EXERCISE.md)

### For Labs
Use instructor-led templates: [Lab Template](../modules/instructor-led/03-LAB.md)

### For Capstone
1. Copy [CAPSTONE-BRIEF.md](CAPSTONE-BRIEF.md)
2. Copy [CAPSTONE-RUBRIC.md](CAPSTONE-RUBRIC.md)
3. Replace all `{{PLACEHOLDER}}` values
4. Customize requirements for your course

---

## Best Practices

### Writing Good Assessments

1. **Align with objectives:** Every question should map to a learning objective
2. **Vary difficulty:** Include easy, medium, and challenging items
3. **Test application:** Prefer "how would you..." over "what is..."
4. **Be specific:** Clear requirements reduce confusion
5. **Provide rubrics:** Students should know how they'll be evaluated

### Common Mistakes to Avoid

- Questions that test memorization only
- Ambiguous requirements
- Unrealistic time estimates
- Missing answer keys
- Inconsistent grading criteria
